Articles.Content:
Did another test and this time with a clean install. Same results. I do still have the bindings logspam even with a unmodded ksp (besides ARP, memgraph), not quite sure whats up with that but thats for another thread.

The garbage collection intervals are barely perceptible at this level but the difference between stock resource panel and ARP can easily be seen on the graph.

log file

I also have an issue.

I was disabling the UI with F2 to have some nice reentry views with the BDB Gemini built-in camera, then I recognized after switching back to "normal" flight mode view that the ARP is only shown when the UI is off and vice versa:

Log:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/glioypvx1djdluf/2018-04-01_1 KSP.log.7z?dl=1

Well those are both pretty average.

For the Mem Alloc one a rewrite of some of the core components is required and I've just not had the time.

For the other one I wonder what I did there. Will dig in on the weekend

@TriggerAu the ARP still doesn't like it when I switch through celestial bodies in map mode using TAB ...

Suddenly it only shows in map view, but no more in flight mode.

A few TAB presses later it doesn't show anymore at all.

I have the idea that could be something with Kopernicus onDemand loading ...

Log:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/nzif6xgpqb66kwj/2018-04-14_5 KSP.log.7z?dl=1
Tryin to free some time next week to look at these two, obvs a few things on this week

I was able to hide my other resources when empty or full, but I can't hide my ablator unless I just click it to "hidden". Is there some obvious thing I'm missing? Is Ablator NEARLY full (at 400/400)? I tried turning off staging and other options. It just doesn't seem to be hideable.

Addition: Also, using spacebar to stage in the map makes a crazy sound if you have no more stages.  It's not terrible cause it sounds like an error, but it doesn't do the same sound if you click the "activate stage" button.

Edited April 21, 2018 by SquarelyCircle

It displays for me under v1.4.2, as well
Thanks guys I have it working now something didn't download properly when I checked the file sizes they where different second download fixed the issue

There is option in advanced options "Resource transfer obeys crossfeed rules". Alternate resource panel ignores this limit and transfers fuel between parts without fuel crossfeed.

It would be great if it was fixed.

Never mind.

Edited June 14, 2018 by Brigadier

On 3/31/2018 at 8:37 PM, Gordon Dry said:

I was disabling the UI with F2 to have some nice reentry views with the BDB Gemini built-in camera, then I recognized after switching back to "normal" flight mode view that the ARP is only shown when the UI is off and vice versa:

I also have this issue. It's hard to pinpoint exactly when it will decide not to show. Sometimes using F2/Hide UI won't make it disappear in UI view right away, but then a couple more times hitting F2 and it's virtually guaranteed to stop showing in UI (but will show when viewing without a UI).

It might have something to do with switching between apps using Windows Alt-TAB. I think I notice it more when I'm in KSP seeing the resource panel, then if I Alt-TAB out to Windows, then back to KSP it seems the resource panel gets confused and won't show in UI view but will show in no-UI view.

Anyone else experiencing this?

I'm currently running KSP 1.4.3 but I also believe this was an issue for me back in 1.3.x days.  Here's my mod list:

Hello, time for a little visit , here is a log: https://www.dropbox.com/s/5sdzcbltobydaoj/saves for LoadingScreenManager.1.output_log.rar?dl=0

Inside there a some of these:

Spoiler
Spoiler

(Filename: C:/buildslave/unity/build/artifacts/generated/common/runtime/DebugBindings.gen.cpp Line: 51)

9/19/2018 6:35:47 PM,KSPAlternateResourcePanel,Unable to load texture ClF5-RealFuels/Resources/ARPIcons/ClF5

 

I wonder if you would take a look at these and see if you can make them vanish from the log? I know that this is not a game troubling issue. It would be nice to have the textures if at all possible.

Are you using RealFuels mod? ARP is looking for RealFuels icons in the RealFuels mod folder. (They should be found)

Maybe you had Realfuels installed before but removed it? Maybe ARP thinks its still installed and is still looking for the icons. 

The other possiblilities is you have CommunityResourcePack mod installed. I know it has a config file (CommonResources.cfg) that points to All the possible ARP icons from various mods.

Looking to see if this is being updated to KSP 1.5.1 ?

I'm hoping so, but not worried about any rush though.  I use it often, and miss it in 1.5.1.

12 hours ago, azander said:

Looking to see if this is being updated to KSP 1.5.1 ?

I'm hoping so, but not worried about any rush though.  I use it often, and miss it in 1.5.1.

Doesn't it work any more? I was sure I'd tried it and it was still working...

It "works" to call it so.

But I strongly suspect that this mod has the same "kind of issues" than KAC and also TWP has this "F2 hidden UI but mod shown" issue.
Is @TriggerAu about and was wondering if there is an update for your excellent Resource Panel, understand your really busy making the game but it could do with a little love

19 hours ago, Virtualgenius said:

Is @TriggerAu about and was wondering if there is an update for your excellent Resource Panel, understand your really busy making the game but it could do with a little love

I asked the same thing, looks like the current one still works in 1.5.1.

Az
A smart way to get this really useful mod updated, would be to have it (or at least most of its unvaluable features) embedded in the next release...
Gonna bring this up to date and look at some stuffs this holidy is my plan, sorry for the lack of comms.
Thats awesome news @TriggerAU

3 hours ago, TriggerAu said:

Gonna bring this up to date and look at some stuffs this holidy is my plan, sorry for the lack of comms.

Fantastic!

Edited December 24, 2018 by Rocket In My Pocket

@TriggerAu I don’t normally suggest this because having mods stock and locked into the quarterly dev cycle stinks when maintainers could be adding new features and fixes faster but both Alternate Resource Panel and Alarm Clock seem pretty locked in for features. Have you ever considered integrating them into stock?
